title: Add QA & Software Testing Career Launch Program ($1,999)

requirements.text: Create a new `/qa-testing` route and landing page for the QA & Software Testing Career Launch Program. The page must compose dedicated section components following the same visual design system, typography, and premium styling as the existing Infrastructure and Data Analytics landing pages.

quotes: Create a new `/qa-testing` landing page with the full content you provided

acceptanceCriteria: Route /qa-testing renders without errors
Page uses the same design system tokens, font families, and layout patterns as /infrastructure and /data-analytics
Page is accessible via navigation Programs dropdown

requirements.text: Build a hero section for the QA landing page with headline 'QA & Software Testing Career Launch Program™', badge/tag '12-Week Intensive | US Market Focused', subheadline 'Break into the tech industry through one of the most accessible entry paths: Quality Assurance.', supporting copy 'No Computer Science degree required. No prior coding experience required.', and a primary CTA button 'Apply for the Next Cohort' linking to /apply.

quotes: QA & Software Testing Career Launch Program
Break into the tech industry through one of the most accessible entry paths: Quality Assurance.

acceptanceCriteria: Headline displays 'QA & Software Testing Career Launch Program™'
Badge shows '12-Week Intensive | US Market Focused'
No CS degree and no coding required messaging is visible
CTA button links to /apply

requirements.text: Build a 'Who This Program Is For' section on the QA landing page listing seven target profiles: career switchers entering tech, business or non-technical graduates, international students in the US, professionals impacted by layoffs, IT support professionals seeking transition, beginners looking for a structured pathway. Include a bold tagline 'This program is focused, fast-paced, and practical.'

quotes: Beginners looking for a structured pathway

acceptanceCriteria: All seven audience profiles are displayed
Tagline 'This program is focused, fast-paced, and practical.' is present

requirements.text: Build a 'Why QA Is a Smart Entry Path in the US' section on the QA landing page. Include bullet points: QA roles exist in nearly every tech company; Fintech, healthcare, SaaS, and enterprise firms require strong QA teams; Entry-level QA positions are more accessible than many engineering roles; Automation knowledge increases salary potential. Display salary ranges: Entry-Level QA (US): $60,000–$80,000 and Automation QA (with experience): $90,000+. Include disclaimer 'Results vary by location and performance.'

quotes: Results vary by location and performance.

acceptanceCriteria: Salary ranges are displayed correctly
Four bullet points about US market opportunity are shown
Disclaimer text is visible

requirements.text: Build a 3-month curriculum section 'What You Will Learn (12-Week Roadmap)' on the QA landing page with three phases: Month 1 – Foundations of Software Testing (SDLC & Agile methodology, role of QA in modern teams, types of testing — functional/regression/UAT/smoke, writing test cases & test scenarios, bug lifecycle & defect tracking, Jira hands-on); Month 2 – Manual + API Testing (web application testing, mobile testing fundamentals, cross-browser testing, API testing using Postman, JSON basics, test execution reporting; project: complete testing cycle for a demo SaaS application); Month 3 – Automation & Job Preparation (basic Java or Python for QA, Selenium fundamentals, automation test scripts, introduction to CI/CD, Git basics; capstone: Manual + API + Automation mini framework). Include note 'We introduce light coding gradually.' for Month 3.
acceptanceCriteria: All three months/phases are displayed with their respective topic lists
Project callout for Month 2 is shown
Capstone project callout for Month 3 is shown
'We introduce light coding gradually.' note is present in Month 3

requirements.text: Build a 'Hands-On Project Experience' section on the QA landing page listing five portfolio deliverables students will complete: a complete test case repository, a defect tracking sample portfolio, API test collection, basic automation scripts, and capstone documentation. Include tagline 'Portfolio-ready material for interviews.'
acceptanceCriteria: All five deliverables are listed
Tagline 'Portfolio-ready material for interviews.' is visible

requirements.text: Build a 'Career Accelerator Layer' section on the QA landing page listing six included services: US-format resume writing, LinkedIn optimization, QA interview question bank, mock interviews, behavioral interview training, job search strategy guidance, and 60-day post-program support. Include messaging 'We prepare you for interviews — not just tools.'

quotes: We prepare you for interviews — not just tools.

acceptanceCriteria: All seven career services are displayed
Messaging 'We prepare you for interviews — not just tools.' is present

requirements.text: Build a 'Program Format & Time Commitment' section on the QA landing page displaying: Duration: 3 Months (12 Weeks), Weekly Live Sessions, Hands-On Projects, 10–15 hours per week commitment, Cohort-Based, 60-Day Post-Program Support, Selective admission. Include note 'This is not passive learning.'
acceptanceCriteria: Duration shown as 3 Months / 12 Weeks
Time commitment of 10–15 hours/week is displayed
Selective admission messaging is present
'This is not passive learning.' note is visible

requirements.text: Build a pricing/investment section on the QA landing page with headline 'Investment', price displayed as '$1,999', note 'Flexible payment options available', and messaging 'This is a focused, structured 12-week career launch program — not just a course.' Include a CTA button 'Apply for the Next Cohort' linking to /apply.
acceptanceCriteria: Price displayed is exactly '$1,999'
'Flexible payment options available' note is shown
CTA button links to /apply

requirements.text: Build a FAQ section on the QA landing page with four questions and answers: 1) 'Is this beginner-friendly?' — Yes. No prior coding required. 2) 'Is automation included?' — Yes, at a foundational level in Month 3. 3) 'Can I get hired after 3 months?' — You will be prepared to apply for entry-level QA roles. Hiring depends on individual effort and market conditions. 4) 'Is this fully online?' — Yes. Live cohort-based format.

quotes: Can I get hired after 3 months?

acceptanceCriteria: All four FAQ items are present and expand/collapse
Answers match the specified content

requirements.text: Build a final CTA section on the QA landing page with headline 'Your First Step Into Tech Starts Here', copy 'Apply for the next QA cohort. Seats are limited to maintain mentorship quality. Break into tech the accessible way — with structure, support, and real skills.', and a primary CTA button 'Apply for the Next Cohort' linking to /apply.

quotes: Seats are limited to maintain mentorship quality

acceptanceCriteria: Headline is displayed
CTA button links to /apply
Urgency messaging about limited seats is present

requirements.text: Add 'QA / Software Testing' as a third option in the program selection dropdown on the /apply application form page. The option value should be 'qa-testing' and the display label should be 'QA & Software Testing Career Launch Program'.

quotes: Add it to Program drop down
Add QA / Software Testing as third option in program selection dropdown on /apply page

acceptanceCriteria: Program dropdown on /apply includes 'QA & Software Testing Career Launch Program' as a selectable option
The option can be submitted with the form

requirements.text: Update the backend ApplicationForm type and Program variant in backend/main.mo to include a third program option for QA & Software Testing (e.g., #qaTestingProgram), so form submissions for this program are stored and retrievable correctly.

quotes: Add QA / Software Testing as third option in program selection dropdown on /apply page

acceptanceCriteria: Program type in Motoko includes a QA / Software Testing variant
Application submissions with QA program selection are stored without errors
Existing applications for the other two programs are unaffected

requirements.text: Add QA & Software Testing as a third program card in the Featured Programs section (FeaturedProgramsSection.tsx) on the home page. The card should display: title 'QA & Software Testing Career Launch Program', blurb 'Your first step into tech — manual testing, API testing, automation basics, and job readiness in 12 weeks.', badge 'Entry-Level Gateway', CTA 'View syllabus' linking to /qa-testing, and cohort microcopy 'Next cohort intake — limited seats.'

quotes: Add QA as third program card in Featured Programs section on home page, positioned as 'Your First Step into Tech' entry-level gateway

acceptanceCriteria: Home page Featured Programs section shows three program cards
QA card displays the correct title, blurb, and badge
'View syllabus' button links to /qa-testing

requirements.text: Update the navigation Programs dropdown in Layout.tsx to include a third link: 'QA & Software Testing' pointing to /qa-testing, positioned below the Infrastructure and Data Analytics links.

quotes: Update navigation Programs dropdown to include QA / Software Testing linking to /qa-testing

acceptanceCriteria: Programs dropdown in the sticky nav contains three items: Infrastructure, Data & Analytics, and QA & Software Testing
Clicking 'QA & Software Testing' navigates to /qa-testing

requirements.text: Update App.tsx to add the /qa-testing route, rendering the new QA landing page component.
acceptanceCriteria: Navigating to /qa-testing renders the QA landing page
All other existing routes remain unaffected

constraints: Price for QA program must be displayed as $1,999 — not $1,499 or $2,999
Do not modify immutable frontend paths: useInternetIdentity, useActor, main.tsx, or ui components
QA landing page must match the existing visual design system (typography, color palette, spacing) used on /infrastructure and /data-analytics
Do not alter existing Infrastructure or Data Analytics program content or pricing
nonGoals: Changing the pricing of the Infrastructure ($2,999) or Data Analytics ($2,999) programs
Adding payment processing or checkout flow
Creating a separate admin view for QA applications
Adding real-time features or external API integrations
